title: CupCakeHugs007
author: CupCakeHugs007
content: I'm a beginner crypto trader.I've watched a lot of YouTube videos and one Youtuber made a lot of sense to me. I contacted him and he said I need to start out using a trading bot.I need to go to webulltradingbot.com and deposit money into the account and the bot will do the trading for me.He claimed I can make 5% a week on my investment.I deposited $20,000 and sure enough, I'm making $1,000 a week.I've then watched all the Crypto scams out there.I figure I've been scammed.However, today I asked to withdraw $10,000 and it's been approved.It will take 2 to 3 days to get to my bank.Can a Crypto trading bot make this kind of money?If I'm being scammed I don't see it.I believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is."

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: I have not used any trading bot before so I don't usually know how they works, but when something seems too good to be true it's likely to be scam. It will be nice for you to drop the link to the trading bot so that other members can verify how trusted the bot is. But to me 5% is high as a weekly ROI, high ROI means a high trade risk.

comments.author: CupCakeHugs007
comments.body: Quote from: Nwada001 on June 27, 2023, 09:15:53 PMI have not used any trading bot before so I don't usually know how they works, but when something seems too good to be true it's likely to be scam. It will be nice for you to drop the link to the trading bot so that other members can verify how trusted the bot is. But to me 5% is high as a weekly ROI, high ROI means a high trade risk. "It will be nice for you to drop the link to the trading bot"I'm new on this site and I didn't know if that would be allowed or not. webulltradingbot.com.  That's the trading bot. I deposit money into the account and the trading bot automatically does the trades for me.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Well I don't know you aim of making this post , it may be genuine that you trying to find out more information about trading bot and on the other hand you selling a trading bot application here regardless mate I think you have to be careful. I have also seen some of such videos on YouTube but the truth is that they are now being invaded by scammers, they take make similar to the owners of those channels or create fake bot to sell out a scam trader. If you gave encountered them then you would probably get scammed if you put in your money, so take you time to verify before going ahead.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: It looks like you might be the latest victim of an ongoing scam, that is, if you are not the same user that posted about it in the scam accusation  - Am I Being Scammed By A Prominent YouTuber?No way you are going to get 5% a week, even if it's a legitimate bot. Trading isn't all about making profits/wins only. At times due to the random movements of the market you will have to make loses even if you are using a good botWhoever tells you to deposit money to them, and they will do the trading for you at an unrealistic percentage per day or week is lying because the offer is too good to be true. I will be damned if you receive any money.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:20:13 PMQuote from: Nwada001 on June 27, 2023, 09:15:53 PMI have not used any trading bot before so I don't usually know how they works, but when something seems too good to be true it's likely to be scam. It will be nice for you to drop the link to the trading bot so that other members can verify how trusted the bot is. But to me 5% is high as a weekly ROI, high ROI means a high trade risk. "It will be nice for you to drop the link to the trading bot"I'm new on this site and I didn't know if that would be allowed or not. webulltradingbot.com.  That's the trading bot. I deposit money into the account and the trading bot automatically does the trades for me. A link is allowed here, provided that the link is not a malicious link trying to hack members.The link you dropped here is not opening. I've tried to open the site to check if it's valid or not, but it's not working.Can you drop some screenshots of the preview or deposit history on the site?

comments.author: CupCakeHugs007
comments.body: Quote from: BIT-BENDER on June 27, 2023, 09:23:32 PMWell I don't know you aim of making this post , it may be genuine that you trying to find out more information about trading bot and on the other hand you selling a trading bot application here regardless mate I think you have to be careful. I have also seen some of such videos on YouTube but the truth is that they are now being invaded by scammers, they take make similar to the owners of those channels or create fake bot to sell out a scam trader. If you gave encountered them then you would probably get scammed if you put in your money, so take you time to verify before going ahead.I'm definitely not trying to sell anything. I just don't know, in reality, if a trading bot can make 5% a week on your investment. When a person watches Youtube cryptocurrency about trading bots, they make it sound like it's true. I didn't know a person could hijack a Youtuber. I guess I was hoping a professional could take a look at it and tell me if I'm being scammed. Because I was able to withdraw $10,000 back to my bank. If they were scammers, would they let me do that?

comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:30:30 PMI didn't know a person could hijack a Youtuber. Well now you knowQuoteI guess I was hoping a professional could take a look at it and tell me if I'm being scammed. How is someone supposed to look into it if you can not share the details such as the name of the YouTuber for starters?QuoteBecause I was able to withdraw $10,000 back to my bank. If they were scammers, would they let me do that?But you said it will take 3 days for the money to get into your bank. So technically, the money isn't yet in your bank account. If you are sure that they are not scammers then I don't see the purpose of this post except if you have a hidden agenda.

comments.author: CupCakeHugs007
comments.body: Quote from: JeromeTash on June 27, 2023, 09:42:05 PMQuote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:30:30 PMI didn't know a person could hijack a Youtuber. Well now you knowQuoteI guess I was hoping a professional could take a look at it and tell me if I'm being scammed. How is someone supposed to look into it if you can not share the details such as the name of the YouTuber for starters?QuoteBecause I was able to withdraw $10,000 back to my bank. If they were scammers, would they let me do that?But you said it will take 3 days for the money to get into your bank. So technically, the money isn't yet in your bank account. If you are sure that they are not scammers then I don't see the purpose of this post except if you have a hidden agenda.The Youtuber is:  Eddie MoonI joined his Patreon and Discord.https://webulltradingbots.com/

comments.author: Pokapoka124
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMI believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is." If you truly believe that, then you certainly wouldn’t have invested your money in that scheme. It pays to be skeptical of such offers, YouTube influencers have a bad record of promoting scam projects to their subscribers. I think this post was made two or three days too early. Why don’t you wait to see if you will get your money or if you will be told a different story. I’m counting on the latter to happen. But why make this inquiry here when the deed has already been done? This is more like medicine after death type situation because there is nothing anyone here can do to help you recover your money.

comments.author: Stalker22
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:30:30 PMI guess I was hoping a professional could take a look at it and tell me if I'm being scammed. What made you feel like you have been scammed? I mean, what did you discover after you had already entrusted them with your money?After taking a first look at their website, I would not invest a single dollar with them. The entire thing is so amateurishly done and is full of grammatical errors and other obvious warning signs that practically screamed "scam." And if a company ever thinks it is smart to publish fake reviews, it is a clear sign to sprint in the opposite direction as fast as you can.Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:30:30 PMBecause I was able to withdraw $10,000 back to my bank. If they were scammers, would they let me do that?Perhaps you simply got lucky, and they allowed you to withdraw some of your money to persuade you into believing that it was legit business. Remember, even notorious Ponzi scams have paid out at least some of their clients. It is all part of their strategy to lure in new investors.

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMHe claimed I can make 5% a week on my investment.Can a Crypto trading bot make this kind of money?If I'm being scammed I don't see it.I believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is."If it is too good to be true, it is not true. If you see it like this, you should stop being greedy.Trading bots are only bots and their operational efficiency will depend on each user like depending on you and how you set up that bot. Those bots are only automating the process and strategy which is set up by each user. If you set it up badly, with bad risk management and terrible trading strategy, a good trading bot will fail to protect your capital, not yet help you gaining profit.[BIG LIST] Crypto Trading bots

comments.author: Zaguru12
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:30:30 PMI'm definitely not trying to sell anything. I just don't know, in reality, if a trading bot can make 5% a week on your investment. When a person watches Youtube cryptocurrency about trading bots, they make it sound like it's true. I didn't know a person could hijack a Youtuber. I guess I was hoping a professional could take a look at it and tell me if I'm being scammed. Because I was able to withdraw $10,000 back to my bank. If they were scammers, would they let me do that?You’re definitely on your way to been scammed. First it is a very bad idea to put your money online, even the most reputable and well known centralized exchanges are advised against and then you have some bot and site which is definitely a scam asking you to deposit there. Secondly the 5% profits is actually the bait here because it is almost impossible to have such profit every week, some investors can have that in a week but there certainly week of less profit and possibly losses too. If they are actually true they would just sell off the trading tips and pairs (which is wrong again) and then charge you. They allow you to withdraw your first for two things. One so that you will trust them and deposit more and secondly you will spread the news just like you are doing now. After all the shenanigans they will tell you the site is under maintenance and that is how your funds will never be returned again.My advice is try as much as possible to take all your funds out if it is still possible and then go get a cryptocurrency trading knowledge and trade your self. More so $20k is a huge some to hold and get a good profit and also minimize risk of loss

comments.author: 348Judah
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMCan a Crypto trading bot make this kind of money?To say the fact it's a no but to give more clarity on this, there might be opportunities that this can be achieved by luck anyway, trading bit aren't as accurate as we may think, they have their own elastic limit to how they can perform trades and using one is not a secured means to stay off the trading risk.Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMIf I'm being scammed I don't see it.I believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is."You're not being scammed if you make use of a bitcoin trading bot, you just show maybe a little part of your weakness in this trading experience, I don't see why some people cannot give it a learning procedures and the required time to invest on learning trading since it's something that will be a continuous process and not a one chance experience for us, bot cannot give you the desired satisfaction needed in trading because they will definitely disappoints you with time.

comments.author: Z390
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMI'm a beginner crypto trader.I've watched a lot of YouTube videos and one Youtuber made a lot of sense to me. I contacted him and he said I need to start out using a trading bot.I need to go to webulltradingbot.com and deposit money into the account and the bot will do the trading for me.He claimed I can make 5% a week on my investment.I deposited $20,000 and sure enough, I'm making $1,000 a week.I've then watched all the Crypto scams out there.I figure I've been scammed.However, today I asked to withdraw $10,000 and it's been approved.It will take 2 to 3 days to get to my bank.Can a Crypto trading bot make this kind of money?If I'm being scammed I don't see it.I believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is."Nice trick, you are new to trading and someone told you about trading not only to end up depositing 20,000$ straight away.What is your aim?Saying this will confuse some idiots to visit that platform you dropped and deposit 20,000$ to make 1000$ too? You are a scammer in disguise and I am pretty sure about it, the truth is all written over you. This forum is full of intelligent people, not some idiots that easily fall for scam tricks like this, I tell you, you will be disappointed. When something is too good to be true, it's a scam 100%.

comments.author: ImThour
comments.body: You paying $20,000 to someone when you don't even understand how the market actually works is enough for you to get scammed, you deserve it at this point mate.There is no crypto bot that makes constant money and those who use a very basic strategy of Grid Buy/Sell tend to have a good return of 15-20% yearly. 5% per week is absurd and complete joke, it will not always be in your favor and you will be losing that 5% which you earned in week(s) gone within a day or so.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMCan a Crypto trading bot make this kind of money?If I'm being scammed I don't see it.I believe, "If it's too good to be true, then it is."Yes its possible I think. There are crypto trading bots that has been used by most traders. Some shared their story of wins and some are loses. It has no difference with the manual trading of a trader except that it could do the work for you. Ive once used a trading bot but it only make me loss some funds. Maybe they arent smart enough to outperform an upredictable market anyway.

comments.author: rozak
comments.body: I can't believe how you as a beginner in crypto trading can easily deposit large amounts of money into a Bot account to trade. although admittedly I have also seen some youtubers using trading bots. but I don't fully like this way for my trading.but I pray for you, hope you get your money back. since it's been confirmed you can get it within the stated time, hopefully, you can update this thread with the latest information about what you started.

comments.author: palle11
comments.body: Quote from: CupCakeHugs007 on June 27, 2023, 09:07:02 PMIt will take 2 to 3 days to get to my bank.You are quite rich to deposit such amount of money summing to $20,000 for a start to a platform you have not tested or withdrawn profit from for the first time. This is surely a risk you have taken. Yes bots have the capacity for profit mostly when there is low volatility but for this, you have taken a huge risk of $20,000, hopefully it will be delivered to your account. Good luck.

comments.author: AakZaki
comments.body: $20,000 is a lot of money, why should you trust that kind of money in a trading Bot and not have to worry about losing.To watch the wrong video as motivation, you should watch how to do trading analysis so you can learn to trade independently, not by using bots that will only take your money away.You have no control over the bots used so you will lose everything. You have to be careful, you have to understand what you are doing.
